agile methodology.exp_short: Agile methodology is a project management approach that emphasizes continuous feedback, collaboration, and iterative development. It is based on four core values: individuals and interactions over processes and tools, working software over comprehensive documentation, customer collaboration over contract negotiation, and responding to change over following a plan. Agile methodology encourages teams to break down large projects into smaller, more manageable pieces and to continually revise and refine the product as they go, allowing for greater flexibility and faster response times.
agile methodology.exp_5yo: Agile methodology is like a game. It helps teams work together to get things done faster. It works by breaking big tasks into small chunks and then working on them one at a time. The team works together to figure out the best way to do each task and then they work together to get it done. They keep doing this until they finish the whole project. It's like playing a game together to get things done faster.
agile methodology.exp_expert: Agile methodology is a set of iterative and incremental software development approaches that focus on customer satisfaction, rapid delivery of working software, and continual improvement through collaboration between self-organizing, cross-functional teams. It emphasizes collaboration between developers, business stakeholders, and end users throughout the development process to ensure that customer requirements are met. Agile methodology allows teams to quickly respond to changing customer needs and market conditions, while still delivering high-quality products. It also encourages collaboration, communication, and continuous improvement, which leads to higher levels of customer satisfaction.

Kanban Boards.exp_short: Kanban boards are a visual workflow management tool used to help teams keep track of tasks and progress. They are made up of columns with cards that represent tasks or items. The cards are moved through the columns as they progress, providing a visual representation of the work in progress and allowing teams to stay organized and on track. Kanban boards are flexible and can be adapted to the specific needs of a team or project.
Kanban Boards.exp_5yo: Kanban boards are like a big to-do list. They have different sections, like a grocery list. Each section has different tasks that need to be done. You can move the tasks around and keep track of what needs to be done and what has been done. It helps you stay organized and finish tasks faster.
Kanban Boards.exp_expert: Kanban Boards are a type of project management tool used to visualize and manage the workflow of a project. It is based on the Kanban methodology, which is a type of Lean manufacturing system that emphasizes continuous improvement and incremental delivery. The Kanban Board consists of columns and cards, where each column represents a stage of the workflow and each card represents a task or item that needs to be completed. The cards are moved from one column to the next as tasks are completed, allowing team members to easily track the progress of the project. This visual representation helps teams identify bottlenecks, prioritize tasks, and manage resources more effectively.

Scrum master.exp_short: Scrum Master is a facilitator who helps a Scrum team adhere to the Scrum framework and practices. They are responsible for ensuring that the team follows the Scrum process, removing any impediments that may arise, and helping the team to self-organize and become more effective. The Scrum Master also serves as the liaison between the team and any external stakeholders, helping to ensure that the team is able to focus on the work at hand and that the product is delivered on time.
Scrum master.exp_5yo: Scrum master is like a coach. They help teams work together to get things done. They help the team stay organized and focused on the goal. They also help the team make sure everyone is doing their part and that everyone is working together. They also help the team figure out how to do things better and faster.
Scrum master.exp_expert: The Scrum Master is a facilitator and coach for an Agile Scrum team. The main role of the Scrum Master is to ensure that the team is working together effectively and efficiently to reach the team's goals. The Scrum Master will help the team to identify and remove any impediments that may be slowing down the team's progress. They will also help guide the team in making decisions and help to ensure that the team is following the Scrum process. The Scrum Master will also work with the Product Owner to ensure that the product backlog is up to date and that the team is working on the most important tasks first.

Jira.exp_short: Jira is a project management and bug-tracking tool used by software teams to manage tasks, track progress, and collaborate. It allows users to create and assign tasks, prioritize tasks, track progress, and manage deadlines. Jira also provides reporting, analytics, and integrations with other tools to help teams stay organized and on track.
Jira.exp_5yo: Jiralike is a project management system that is used to organize and manage tasks, track progress, and collaborate with team members. It is a cloud-based software that allows users to create projects, assign tasks, and track progress. It also provides tools for communication, such as discussion forums, messaging, and notifications. Additionally, Jiralike allows users to set deadlines, prioritize tasks, and track time spent on tasks. It is designed to be used by teams of any size, from small businesses to large enterprises.
Jira.exp_expert: Jirato is an enterprise-grade software platform designed to streamline business processes and operations. It provides a comprehensive suite of tools and features that enable companies to automate their workflows and manage their data, projects, and resources. Jirato's key features include enterprise resource planning (ERP) capabilities, project management, customer relationship management (CRM) tools, and analytics. With Jirato, companies can easily manage their resources, track their progress, and optimize their operations. Additionally, Jirato offers a wide range of integrations with third-party software and services, allowing businesses to further streamline their operations.

Docker.exp_short: Docker is a containerization technology that allows developers to package applications into self-contained units that can be easily deployed and managed in different environments. It creates isolated containers that can be run on any machine without any additional setup, making it easier to deploy and manage applications. By using Docker, developers can quickly and easily build, deploy, and run applications in a secure and consistent environment.
Docker.exp_5yo: Docker is like a big box that can hold lots of different things. It can hold programs, files, and other things that you need to use on your computer. You can put all the things you need in the box, and then you can take the box with you wherever you go. That way you always have all the things you need with you. It's like a really big, really useful suitcase!
Docker.exp_expert: Docker is a software platform that enables developers to develop, deploy, and run applications in a containerized environment. It is based on the concept of containerization, which isolates applications from their underlying infrastructure, allowing them to run in any environment. Docker containers are lightweight and portable, making them ideal for quickly deploying applications in any environment. Docker also provides an extensive set of tools for managing and monitoring containers, making it easy to manage complex applications in production.

Database Normalization.exp_short: Database normalization is the process of organizing data into separate tables in order to reduce data redundancy and improve data integrity. It involves breaking down data into its smallest possible form, and then organizing it into related groups in order to avoid data duplication and ensure data accuracy. Normalization helps to reduce data storage costs, improve data integrity and make it easier to retrieve data from the database. It also helps to keep data consistent across the entire database.
Database Normalization.exp_5yo: Database normalization is like organizing your room. You have a lot of stuff in your room and it can get very messy. With database normalization, you organize your stuff into different groups so it's easier to find what you need. For example, you might have all your stuffed animals in one group, all your books in another group, and all your toys in another group. This way, when you're looking for something, you know exactly where to look.
Database Normalization.exp_expert: Database Normalization is a process of organizing the data in a database to reduce data redundancy and improve data integrity. This process involves organizing the data into tables and columns, and defining relationships between the tables. Normalization usually involves dividing larger tables into smaller tables and defining relationships between them. Normalization also includes defining rules to ensure the accuracy and consistency of the data. Normalization helps to reduce data redundancy and improve data integrity by ensuring that data is stored in only one place, and that all data is related to the same subject. Normalization also helps to improve query performance by reducing the amount of data that needs to be accessed.

Database Engineering.exp_short: Database engineering is the process of designing, creating, implementing, and maintaining a database. It involves the use of data modeling techniques to define the structure of the database and the use of database management systems to create and maintain the database. Database engineering ensures that the database is optimized for performance and accuracy, and is able to store and retrieve data efficiently.
Database Engineering.exp_5yo: Database engineering is like building a big house. First, you need to decide what kind of house you want to build and what kind of rooms you want in it. Then, you need to figure out how to make all the rooms fit together in a way that makes sense. Finally, you need to build the house and make sure it's safe and secure. With database engineering, you're doing the same thing, but instead of building a house, you're building a database. You decide what kind of information you want to store in the database, then you figure out how to put it all together so it makes sense, and finally you make sure it's secure and easy to use.
Database Engineering.exp_expert: Database Engineering is the process of designing, implementing, and maintaining databases in order to store, organize, and access data. Database Engineers work to ensure the accuracy, integrity, and security of the data in the database. They are responsible for the development, implementation, and maintenance of database systems, including the design of data models, the creation of database objects, the optimization of database performance, and the development of data security policies. Database Engineers must have a strong understanding of database technologies, including relational and non-relational databases, and be able to develop effective solutions to complex data problems.

Data Analyst.exp_short: Data Analysts are responsible for collecting, organizing, and analyzing data to identify patterns, trends, and relationships. They use their findings to inform decisions, optimize processes, and develop strategies. Data Analysts often use software tools to extract, clean, and transform data, and then use statistical techniques to interpret and visualize the results. They also create reports, dashboards, and other visualizations to communicate their insights.
Data Analyst.exp_5yo: Data analysts are like detectives. They look at data, which is a lot of numbers, and try to figure out what the numbers mean. They use their detective skills to figure out what the data is telling them. They look for patterns and trends in the data so they can help businesses make better decisions.
Data Analyst.exp_expert: Data Analysts are professionals who analyze data to identify patterns and trends that help inform decisions and strategies. They use data-driven techniques to uncover insights and develop actionable plans. They use a variety of tools such as spreadsheets, databases, and data visualization tools to analyze data and create reports and presentations. Data Analysts are also responsible for collecting, cleaning, and preparing data for further analysis. They often work with stakeholders to ensure data accuracy and integrity. Data Analysts use their findings to develop strategies that can help organizations reach their goals.

Data Scientist.exp_short: Data Scientists are professionals who use data to solve business problems. They use a combination of skills such as statistics, machine learning, programming, and data visualization to analyze large datasets and uncover insights. Data Scientists create predictive models, identify trends and patterns, and build data-driven solutions that help businesses make better decisions and improve their operations. They are experts in extracting value from data and are essential for any organization that wants to maximize its data-driven potential.
Data Scientist.exp_5yo: Data Scientists are like detectives. They use special tools and skills to look for clues in data to help solve problems. They use their detective skills to find patterns, trends, and relationships in data that can help people make better decisions. Data Scientists help people understand how the world works and how to use data to make it better.
Data Scientist.exp_expert: Data Scientists are experts in extracting knowledge and insights from large datasets by applying a combination of scientific, mathematical, and programming skills to develop models and algorithms. They use these models and algorithms to discover patterns and trends in data, and to make predictions and recommendations. Data Scientists also use data visualization techniques to present their findings in an understandable way.

Software Engineer.exp_short: Software engineering is a field of engineering that focuses on the development of software products. It involves the application of engineering principles, methods, and techniques to the design, development, testing, and maintenance of software systems. Software engineers use their technical expertise to create, maintain, and improve software products. They use their knowledge of programming languages and software development tools to solve complex problems and develop innovative solutions. Software engineers are responsible for ensuring that software products are efficient, reliable, and secure.
Software Engineer.exp_5yo: Software engineers are like builders. They use special tools to create things that make computers work better. They write code, which is like a set of instructions that tell the computer what to do. They also design and test software to make sure it works correctly and is safe to use.
Software Engineer.exp_expert: Software engineering is a field of engineering that focuses on the design, development, maintenance, and testing of software systems. It is a systematic approach to software development that applies engineering principles, processes, and methods to the creation of software. It combines the principles of engineering, computer science, and mathematics to create software solutions that are reliable, efficient, and cost-effective. Software engineers use a range of tools and techniques to develop software, including object-oriented programming, software design patterns, software architecture, and software development methodologies. They also need to understand the business requirements and user needs in order to develop effective software solutions.

Tableau.exp_short: Tableau is a business intelligence and analytics platform that helps organizations quickly and easily visualize, analyze, and share data. It enables users to quickly create interactive data visualizations, dashboards, and reports from a wide variety of data sources. Tableau provides powerful tools to explore, analyze, and visualize data, enabling users to quickly identify trends, correlations, and outliers. It also provides an intuitive user interface and drag-and-drop functionality, making it easy for users of any skill level to create powerful data visualizations.
Tableau.exp_5yo: Tableau is a data visualization software that allows users to quickly and easily create visualizations from data. It helps users to quickly identify trends, outliers, and patterns in data that would otherwise be difficult to detect. It also allows users to create interactive dashboards and storyboards that can be used to communicate insights to others. Tableau can be used to analyze data from a variety of sources, including spreadsheets, databases, and online services.
Tableau.exp_expert: Tableauto is a software platform that provides a comprehensive set of tools for automating data management tasks. It is designed to help technical experts manage large amounts of data quickly and efficiently. Tableauto offers several features such as data replication, data migration, data transformation, and data integration. It also provides an easy-to-use graphical user interface (GUI) to help users quickly and easily manage their data. Tableauto also offers powerful features such as data filtering, data aggregation, data visualization, and data analysis. Furthermore, it can be used to create automated workflows and processes to streamline data management tasks.

Pandas.exp_short: Pandas is a Python library that provides high-level data structures and data analysis tools for working with structured data. It is designed to make data processing and analysis easier and faster. It provides powerful data manipulation and analysis capabilities such as data wrangling, aggregation, joining, reshaping, and plotting. Pandas also provides a wide range of data manipulation and analysis tools such as groupby, pivot tables, and time-series functionality. It is highly optimized for performance and memory usage, making it a popular choice for data scientists.
Pandas.exp_5yo: Pandas are big, cuddly animals that live in China. They look like big bears with big black-and-white patches all over their bodies. They eat mostly bamboo leaves, so they like to live in places with lots of bamboo. Pandas are very friendly and like to play and cuddle. They make a lot of funny noises and are very cute!
Pandas.exp_expert:
Pandas is a Python library that provides high-level data structures and extensive tools for data analysis. It is designed to make data manipulation and analysis easier and faster. Pandas is a powerful tool for data analysis and manipulation, with features such as: 

-Data manipulation and cleaning
-Data analysis and exploration
-Data visualization
-Data manipulation and aggregation
-Data wrangling
-Data transformation

Pandas is used in a variety of fields, including finance, economics, statistics, and data science. It is also used to create interactive web applications. Pandas is designed to work with data of any size and can be used to process large datasets quickly and efficiently. It is also designed to work with both structured and unstructured data.

Pyspark.exp_short: PySpark is a Python API for Apache Spark, a distributed computing framework for large-scale data processing. It provides an easy-to-use programming interface for creating and manipulating Spark objects such as RDDs, DataFrames, and SQL tables. PySpark enables users to quickly and easily parallelize and scale their data processing workloads, making it an ideal tool for data scientists and engineers.
Pyspark.exp_5yo: PySpark is a programming language that is used to process data in a distributed environment. It is a Python library that allows you to use the power of Apache Spark, a powerful open-source data processing framework, to analyze and process large datasets. PySpark allows you to use the Python language to create powerful data analysis applications that can be used to analyze, transform, and clean large datasets. It also makes it easier to work with large datasets in a distributed environment.
Pyspark.exp_expert: Pyspark is a Python library for distributed data processing that enables users to interact with distributed data sets using a familiar Python API. It provides access to powerful distributed computing resources and allows for data processing on a large scale. Pyspark enables users to process large amounts of data quickly and efficiently using the Spark engine, which is a distributed computing framework. Pyspark also provides an easy to use API for creating data pipelines and machine learning models. It can be used for data analysis, data mining, and real-time stream processing.

SQL.exp_short: SQL (Structured Query Language) is a programming language used to manage data stored in relational databases. It is used to insert, update, delete, and query data from a database. SQL can also be used to create and modify database structures, such as tables, views, and indexes. It is a powerful tool for managing data and is widely used in web applications and data warehouses.
SQL.exp_5yo: SQL stands for Structured Query Language. It's a way of talking to a computer so it can understand what you want it to do. It's like giving the computer a set of instructions to follow. For example, you can use SQL to tell the computer to find certain information in a database, like the names of all the people who live in a certain city.
SQL.exp_expert: SQL (Structured Query Language) is a programming language used to interact with databases. It is used to query, insert, update, and delete data from a database. It is a declarative language, meaning that it describes what data should be retrieved, rather than how to retrieve it. SQL is used in many applications such as web development, data analysis, and data warehousing. SQL statements are composed of clauses, expressions, and predicates. Clauses are used to identify the data to be manipulated, expressions are used to specify the operations to be performed on the data, and predicates are used to filter the data. SQL is a powerful language that can be used to create complex queries and data manipulation tasks.

l1 normalization.exp_short: L1 normalization is a technique used to normalize a vector such that the sum of its absolute values is equal to 1. It is a type of vector normalization that is often used in machine learning and data science. It is also known as least absolute deviations (LAD), least absolute errors (LAE) or Taxicab norm. L1 normalization is particularly useful when dealing with sparse data, as it ensures that all elements of the vector are given equal importance. This helps to prevent bias in the data, which can lead to better performance of the model.
l1 normalization.exp_5yo: L1 normalization is a way of making sure that all numbers in a group are treated equally. It works by making sure that the sum of all the numbers in the group is equal to one. For example, if you have five numbers in a group, the sum of those numbers should be 1. To make this happen, each number is divided by the total sum of all the numbers in the group. That way, each number gets a fair share of the total sum, making sure that all the numbers are treated equally.
l1 normalization.exp_expert: L1 normalization is a mathematical technique used to normalize a vector of values so that the sum of the absolute values of the components of the vector is equal to 1. This technique is often used to normalize data in machine learning algorithms to reduce the effect of large values on the overall result. In particular, L1 normalization can be used to reduce the effect of outliers on the results of a model. It is also used to make the data more interpretable and to reduce the computational complexity of certain algorithms.
